The game isn't a ten nor a zero. It functions well\, and has some improvements\, but it isn't flawless. Not even close. The fact this game relies heavily on the story instead of gameplay really drags down the overall score.Story wise\, it's biggest problem is pacing. It is **** awful. The current pacing of the story is: Be with Joel and Ellie until Joel's Death. Split between Ellie and the new character Abby\, with a little more emphasis on Abby. Multiple flashbacks\, and even flash backing in flashbacks (never do that ever.) Then the climax. The pacing is awful and should've been rewritten. Here's how I would've done it.Start off as Abby searching for a cureFinds out it doesn't exist because of JoelGoes on a manhunt for Joel (but doesn't know who it is)Switch to Joel and EllieBattles not only zombies\, but also these slave traders that are in the gameCrosses paths with AbbyAbby\, not knowing that is the right Joel\, befriends themJoel and Ellie have their argumentEllie tells Abby about Joel's decision (from LOS) in frustrationAbby realizes that is the Joel she is searching forAbby (or someone else) kills Joel (Abby feels regret for doing so)Ellie goes on her revenge tripAbby gets capturedEllie finds Abby and have their final battlePlayer decision to either forgive or kill Abby.Puts that whole story in different context doesn't it? But that's just my thoughts.Gameplay\, Naughty Dog did improve it. Some tweaking with the aiming\, and Abby is a good laugh to play as. She feels pretty OP\, and it is a blast. Punching zombies\, her unbelievable speed (with her body type)\, she's hilarious and fun. I feel like it gets forgotten about because of her storyline.Anyway.
